channel.title: What's your religion?
channel.description:
Not trying to start any religious debates here, (at least for now) I just want to know what you guys hold true about a supreme being or not whether it be Agnosticism, Atheism, Pseudo-Christianity, Islamic...
Follow this format
[u][i][b]Format: [/b][/i][/u] [u]What's your religion?:[/u]Islam
[u]How long have you been/believed this?:[/u]My whole life.
[u]Were you indoctrinated based on the society, people, and culture you grew up in or was it completely of your own choice growing up?:[/u] It was mostly my choice, and a few other things convinced me.
[u]Do you have religious tolerance for others around you?:[/u] (Not only on the internet either)I have a tolerance for all religions, as long as they're not attempting to deep-throat skull fuck me with their beliefs thinking I'll fall to my knees and accept it.

item.title: What's your religion?
item.dc:creator: @mona_lisa mona lisa
item.description:
@mona_lisa wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:94, topic:403456”][quote author=Mitko link=topic=500520.msg3664687#msg3664687 date=1310549805]
What? What does not having some tooth have to do with proving evolution right?
[/quote]

The fact wisdom teeth are:

  1. Are no longer needed.
  2. They were there from a time when our ancestors had larger jaws to accomodate for those teeth. That is why we have trouble with them now, for those of us that get them - they often grow in such a way that push the other teeth out of shape or cause other problems.

People in this thread saying they don’t have them are pointing out the fact that at one point, a genetic mutation somewhere up their ancestry meant that one person didn’t grow them and as they reproduced, that mutation was passed down. As there are a significant population now (though, not a majority) of people who don’t grow wisdom teeth, it is increasingly more likely that someone who do grow them reproduce with someone that doesn’t, also increasing the chance of the good genetic mutation (removing wisdom teeth) being passed down to the child of those two.

A basic outline, and there is more to it, but the main point is there. Evolution ;)[/quote]

no it just means your fucking deformed.

Read full topic

item.title: What's your religion?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Well. It depends. You personally? Maybe not.

Some people who try and teach unproven religious claims in science classes in schools. They cause harm. Vast religious organisations who push the idea that evolution isn’t proven do cause harm. If it were any other subject that didn’t contradict the bible, the amount of evidence given for evolution would be more than enough to establish it as fact.

Also, believing something because it hasn’t been proven otherwise, yet also hasn’t got any evidence in it’s favour (religion) isn’t a good reason to believe. The rational approach is to only follow something that has been proven through evidence, not follow something just because you want it to be true. They’re the ones harming people, harming society, harming human progression. They’re convincing people that scientific fact is not fact, and thus producing a larger population of ignorant people who aren’t using their brand power to productively contribute to the world.

I’ve purposely not touched on all evils through our history that have been done in the name of religion, because you all know them anyway.

I would love for some of the claims of the afterlife to be true. How cool would it be to be looked after this kind and loving supernatural being (that is described in the abrahamic religions), and being in what heaven is described like? Realists don’t reject how good and great it would be, but realists look for evidence in everything, because evidence based knowledge is the basis for all success in intelligent life, not only in our species.

Read full topic

item.description:

DannyC:

7% Of humans are religious. Put this as your signature if you are one of the 93% that realized divine forces do not exist.

where is this fact? i think u just pulled this out of ur uk what. ik its wikipedia but it would prove otherwise. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Religion#Religious_movements and until someone can prove to me beyond a shadow of a doubt that this is all there is and that when we die thats all(which will never happen until science becomes so advanced that it has things that can not even imagine atm), i will continue to believe what i currently do. am i causing harm to anyone by believing in God? no.

Read full topic

People in this thread saying they don’t have them are pointing out the fact that at one point, a genetic mutation somewhere up their ancestry meant that one person didn’t grow them and as they reproduced, that mutation was passed down. A basic outline, and there is more to it, but the main point is there. Evolution
